questions.question: What is the primary objective of Analytical Chemistry?
options: To identify what is in a sample
To determine how much of a compound is present in a sample
Both to identify what is in a sample and to determine how much of it is present
None of the above
questions.correct_answer: Both to identify what is in a sample and to determine how much of it is present

questions.question: What is a standard solution in chemistry?
options: A solution whose concentration is accurately known
A solution used for cleaning glassware
A solution that neutralizes acids and bases
A solution that always has a pH of 7
questions.correct_answer: A solution whose concentration is accurately known

questions.question: What technique uses the light absorption principle to measure the concentration of a solute in a solution?
options: Spectrophotometry
Chromatography
Titration
Centrifugation

questions.question: What is the purpose of using an indicator in a titration process?
options: To change the color of the solution at the equivalence point
To increase the reaction rate
To reduce the concentration of the analyte
To precipitate the solute from the solution
questions.correct_answer: To change the color of the solution at the equivalence point

questions.question: Which of the following is a commonly used analytical technique that separates components based on their different affinities towards a stationary phase and a mobile phase?
options: Chromatography
Distillation
Crystallization
Decantation

questions.question: What is the term for the substance being analyzed in Analytical Chemistry?
options: Reagent
Analyte
Solvent
Standard

questions.question: What does pH measure?
options: The concentration of H+ ions in a solution
The concentration of OH- ions in a solution
The temperature of a solution
The amount of solute in a solution
questions.correct_answer: The concentration of H+ ions in a solution

questions.question: What is the purpose of a blank solution in spectroscopic measurements?
options: To calibrate the instrument
To dissolve the analyte
To compare with the standard solution
To detect impurities in the reagents

questions.question: What is Gravimetric Analysis?
options: A method of analysis based on the separation of the desired constituent
A method of analysis based on measuring the mass of a specific compound or element
A method of analysis based on the absorption of light
A method of analysis based on the neutralization reactions
questions.correct_answer: A method of analysis based on measuring the mass of a specific compound or element

questions.question: What principle is Gas Chromatography based on?
options: The separation of compounds based on their boiling points
The separation of compounds based on their solubility in a solvent
The separation of compounds based on their reaction rates
The separation of compounds based on their color
questions.correct_answer: The separation of compounds based on their boiling points
